content: Hello, I need a simple incoming webhook that will POST something to some zulip.com endpoint and send a message to one of my topics. However, I can find absolutely no documentation on this rudimentary use case. Could some documentation be added please?
@Stavros Korokithakis Have you looked at https://zulipchat.com/api/?
@Anders Kaseorg yes, many times. Is it mentioned somewhere?
Well, the third bullet point on that page has two links that seem to answer exactly that question.

I do think our API documentation around "incoming webhooks" should probably have stronger highlighting in e.g. the left sidebar navigation for how to send a message without modifying the server if that's all you want to do. (Potentially a stub page that just links to the REST API docs).

@David Rosa FYI.
@Stavros Korokithakis If https://zulipchat.com/api/send-message is what you were looking for, could you comment on why you had trouble finding it? This could help us improve visibility of such docs.
@Tim Abbott Maybe a new page in FAQ style with links to relevant docs would be helpful?
I think we just need something in the "Incoming webhooks" section that's a top-level item with a title like "Generic incoming webhook".
It can potentially even just be a link to the REST API page.
The issue is folks who are looking for something of that form and not finding it.

Ah okay, I think I see what you mean. So you are saying add something like "Generic incoming webhook" to the "Integrations" navbar section right after "Overview " or after "Incoming webhook integrations".

Hey so I was thinking maybe it would make sense to rename some titles also?

  • Rename "Integrations" section to "Incoming webhooks"
  • Rename "Incoming webhook integrations" item to just "Integrations"
  • Rename "Non-webhook integrations" item to "Other Integrations"
  • Add new "Generic webhooks" item as a link to the REST API page
@David Rosa @Tim Abbott the reason why I wasn't finding it is that I was expecting a webhook integration (since I'm trying to add a webhook), so it never occurred to me to look at the API docs
Also, something very useful would be a webhook that allowed me to POST messages without a body (for services that don't let you set the POST body), using a query string instead
I think our existing REST API may support using query string parameters instead of the POST body, it just isn't documented. But I haven't tested recently. Can you try doing that?
